bwwExcerpt: Lear deBessonet's superb production of the Sondheim and James Lapine modern classic "Into the Woods," which originated at Encores! in May, has made the journey west and south to Broadway. Despite some cast changes, its humor, wonder and humanity have arrived intact. Indeed, they may glimmer even more brightly at the St. James Theater than they did at City Center. So if you saw that recent staging, should you go into the woods again? Unless your budget doesn't run to Broadway prices, of course yo
